gurmukhi: jwie prXo qb hI sr mY qn bsqR Dry pun bUf gXo hY ] bUfq jo inksXo soaU BUpq ic`q ibKY Aiq kop kXo hY ]
transliteration: Jaae Parryo Tab Hisar Mai Tan Bastra Ddare Poun Bood Gado Hai|| Boodat Jo Niksyo Sooo Bhoopat Chitt Bikhai At(i) Kop Kayo Hai||
translation: He fell down in the tank and with all his clothes, he became drenched; when he came out after getting drowned in water, he became extremely enraged in his mind;

gurmukhi: kwnH jU Bwr auqwrn qy ihq AwNK so BImih Byd dXo hY ] so ieh BwNq so bol auiTE Ary AMD ky AMD hI puqR BXo hY ]2363]
transliteration: Kaahn Joo Bhaar Outaaran Te Hit Aankh So Bheemah(i) Bhed Dayo Hai|| So Eh Bhaant So Bol Outhiodare Andh Ke Andh Hipoutra Bhayo Hai||2363||
translation: Then Krishna hinted to Bhima with his eye, who immediately said, “the sons of blind are also blind.”2363.

gurmukhi: XoN jb BIm hsXo iqh kau qu Gno icq BIqr BUp irswXo ] mokau pMf ko puqR hsY Ab hI bD Xw ko kro jIA AwXo ]
transliteration: Yon Jab Bheem Hasyo Tih Kau Tu Ghano Chit Bheear Bhoop Risaayo|| Mokau Pand Ko Poutra Hasai Ab Hibadh Yaa Ko Daro Jeea Aayo||
translation: When Bhima laughed, saying this, the king (Duryodhana) got extremely infuriated in his mind; “The sons of Pandu are laughing over me; I shall kill Bhima just now.”

gurmukhi: BIKm dRox irsy mn mY jV BIm BXo kh sXwm sunwXo ] Dwm gXo Apuny iPr kY su sBw ieh BIqr Pyr n AwXo ]2364]
transliteration: Bheekham Dron Rise Man Mai Jad Bheem Bhayo Kah Syaam Sounaayo|| Dhaam Gado Apoune Phir Kai Su Sabhaa Eh Bheetar Pher Na Aayo||2364||
translation: When Bhishma and Karan also got angry, Bhima became fearful and ran away to his home and did not return.2364.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky gRMQy kiRSnw Avqwry durjoDn sBw dyK Dwm gey DXwie ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatke Granthe Krishnaa Avtdare Durjodhan Sabhaa Dekh Dhaam Gad Dhyaae||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Duryodhana went back to his home after seeing the Court-Building” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of fighting with the demon Bakatra

gurmukhi: auq kop dRujoDn Dwm gXo ieq dYq huqo iqh kopu bswXo ] kwnH hqXo isspwl huqo myro imqR mirE n rqI sukcwXo ]
transliteration: Out Kop Drujodhan Dhaam Gado It Dait Houto Tih Kop(u) Basaayo|| Kaahn Hatyo Sispaal Houto Mero Mitra Mario Na Ratisoukchadyo||
translation: On that side Duryodhana went away and on this side a demon thinking this became angry that Krishna had killed his friend Shishupal fearlessly;

gurmukhi: lY iSv qy br hO ieh ko bDu jwie kro jIA BIqr AwXo ] Dwie ikdwr kI Er cilXo kib sXwm iehY icq mY ThrwXo ]2365]
transliteration: Lai Shiv Te Bar Hau Eh Ko Badh(u) Jaae Daro Jeea Bheetar Aayo|| Dhaae Kidaar Kior Chaliyo Kabi Syaam Ihai Chit Mai Thahraayo||2365||
translation: He thought that he could kill Krishna after obtaining a boon from Shiva and thinking about it, he started for Kedar.2365.

gurmukhi: bdRI ikdwr ky BIqr jwie kY syv krI mhw rudR irJwXo ] lY kY ibvwn cilE auq qy jb hI hir ky bD ko bru pwXo ]
transliteration: Badrikidaar Ke Bheetar Jaae Kai Sev Karimahaa Rudra Rijhaayo|| Lai Kai Bivaan Chadio Out Te Jab Hihar(i) Ke Badh Ko Bar(u) Paayo||
translation: He went to Badri-Kedarnath, where he, through great austerities, pleased the great Shiva and when he obtained the boon of killing Krishna, he mounted the air-vehicle and went;

gurmukhi: dÍwrvqI hUM ky BIqr Awie kY kwnH ky puqR so ju`Du mcwXo ] so suin sXwm ibdw lY kY BUp qy sXwm BnY iqh Taur isDwXo ]2366]
transliteration: Dvaaratihoon Ke Bheetar Aae Kai Kaahn Ke Poutra Juddh(u) Machadyo|| So Soun(i) Syaam Bidaa Lai Kai Bhoop Te Syaam Bhanai Tih Thaur Sidhaayo||2366||
translation: On coming to Dwarka, he began the fighting with the son of Krishna; when Krishna heared this, he bade farewell to king Yudhishtar and went there.2366.

gurmukhi: dÍwrvqI hUM ky bIc jbY hir jU gXo qau soaU S`qR inhwrXo ] sXwm BnY qb hI iqh kau lru ry hm so biRjnwQ aucwrXo ]
transliteration: Dvaarvatihoon Ke Beech Jabai Har(i) Joo Gado Tau Sooo Shattra Nihdaryo|| Syaam Bhanai Tab Hitih Kau Lar(u) Reham So Brijnaath Oucdaro||
translation: When Krishna reached Dwarka, he saw the enemy and challenging him asked him to come forward for fighting with him;
